text:
Hi everyone ! For people who use Zapier, I try to use the 'API Request (Beta) in HubSpot' action, I did a Patch request to '/crm/v3/objects/xxxx/xxxx' but I get an error:
*Failed to create a http request in HubSpot*
Raw request failed.

Additional informations:
In URL input: "<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/XXXX/XXXX>"
In body input: '{ "properties": {"property1": "test"} }'
Is something wrong ?

Okay I tried to use it with the object "Contacts" and it worked, but I wish to use that with custom object, and I thought that was the goal of this action -> Use endpoint not implemented yet.. Don't tell me we can't use that with custom object... Not again HubSpot limitations :smiling_face_with_tear:

for a custom object you need to use the objectTypeId, or the fullyQualifiedName value.
Example:
POST request to /crm/v3/objects/2-3465404

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/crm-custom-objects>
<@U04UF7BNBK4> Thank you for your answer, but yes, this is what I used.. Does it work for you on your side with this Zapier action ?
Okay I misunderstood your problem because you said HubSpot Limitation but itâ€™s maybe a zapier limitation. I have not used this zapier action but work with the HubSpot api every day.
<@U04UF7BNBK4> Oh yes with HubSpot api it works for me too, but not in Zapier...

<@U04UF7BNBK4> In fact, I need to update a custom object after a new entry in Typeform.. I wanted to do it with Zapier, but if this action doesn't work I can't do it this way.. And can you confirm me that we can't call a HubSpot workflow from another service (like Zapier) ?
you cannot directly trigger a workflow with a webhook. but you could do a workaround, e.g. create a custom property as a "trigger". And then you just update that value to trigger the workflow.

Hi guys! I am doing an Integration in HubSpot worflow with What'sApp message sending. I've created a template of service type, it's already approved but I can't select it to send message via What'sApp, Does someone know what it's going on? How I can solve it.
<@U04QRQ8N8US> This all works fine on my end (just ran a test in zap)
You said you're trying to update a custom object but you have a POST request, that's probably the problem to update an object you need to set it to PATCH

I think he started with a patch request based on the conversation in general. I just posted a post request highlighting the objectTypeId part of the url.

But can you show the request you made in zapier <@U01QVR44MEY>? Maybe I will dive deeper into Zapier again if these things are possible now.
Sure one moment
Here's an example:
It would work the same way if you were doing a create just make it a POST request and remove the id from the end of the url

Hey everyone, I was wondering if anyone has used this HubSpot postman collection before?

<https://www.postman.com/riandolo-oboagency/workspace/standard-HubSpot/documentation/12724346-206a97e2-4485-4081-ad5f-e862dac1bf15>

I am trying to use this to create a custom integration connection using Microsoft Power Automate. I am really struggling trying to get the right inputs into this page on Power Automate.

Figured folks here might enjoy this new post I just published to the HubSpot Developer Blog:
<https://www.linkedin.com/posts/mclarenjon_using-the-crm-imports-api-to-import-records-activity-7053828044389576704-YmtR?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop|Turning the HubSpot CRM into a Dad-abase of Dad Jokes using Custom Objects and the CRM Imports API>
This is probably the best post on the dev blog
I feel like you tried to create a mini Dharmesh keynote article

One thing that would be super cool to point out is multi object imports with associations. So in your example, import the firstname, lastname, and email of the joke creator and then have the import tool automatically associate them (also set the email as a unique property so it just updates the old contacts/associates them to the notes)
